intro: Astropanax mannii, commonly known as the Malagasy ginseng, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant is known for its medicinal properties, with roots and leaves used in traditional medicine. It thrives in tropical rainforests and requires a humid, shaded environment. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in some regions.
